item.title: Teixi
item.description:
@manisha @Neurograce @neuroscience @cogsci @cogneurophys @PessoaBrain @cian comment in thread reminded me:@kordinglab recent talks on how #computationalneuroscience #ml methods, while spread across labs & papers, still face #neurotheory proven grounds:Does the #brain do #gradientDescent ?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E5hATeCZQnU#causality for #neuroscience & beyond
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XUD69JshQTk#philosophyofneuroscience
#systemsneuroscience
#mindbrainps: IMHO #ml yea: best when for discovery, not causality

item.title: mekka okereke :verified:
item.description: When you do your "Oppenheimer calculus," and are justifying the dropping of the bomb because it "saved more lives than it cost," remember to factor in the creation of the Congo crisis (100K dead in under 4 years), and the assassination of Patrice Lumumba.Where did the Uranium come from? And how did the US ensure that neither the Germans or the Russians would get any?(Answers: The Congo. By eliminating Lumumba)https://www.theguardian.com/world/2000/aug/10/martinkettlehttps://fnl.mit.edu/january-february-2021/the-legacy-of-the-involvement-of-the-democratic-republic-of-the-congo-in-the-bombs-dropped-on-hiroshima-and-nagasaki/

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
A thread on guest post by Huanzi Zhang http://deevybee.blogspot.com/2023/07/is-hindawi-well-positioned-for.html
It digs into some of the financial aspects of @WileyGlobal‚Äôs acquisition of @Hindawi.
One draw for #Wiley was the low cost of #Hindawi‚Äôs lean fully open access operation
The acquisition looked like a good move, because of huge appetite in #China for open access publishing. Seemed like win-win, as Chinese researchers cld find a home for papers they needed for promotion etc, and Wiley could profit from the APCs.
1/n #publishing

item.title: Erik Moeller
item.description: With Twitter rebranding itself out of existence, millions of websites will have to update their "follow" and "share" buttons.A perfect opportunity to finally add Mastodon or Fediverse buttons.

item.title: James Heathers
item.description: I really hope my Actual Science People continue to use this platform and it can be walled off as a place to talk about The Really Hard Shit. Not all science communication has to be for everyone, and it would be nice to have a TEH VACINES DID IT free space that is also actually populated with people I'd talk to more than once.

item.title: Louis Ingenthron
item.description: @stevesilberman For that take to be true, Elon would have to have had clear goals beforehand and would have needed the necessary focus and dedication over the course of months to work towards those goals.That seems to be vastly overestimating his abilities.Occam's Razor says he bought a fun toy and the rest is just rich guy flailing.Attributing malice to his incompetence is a fool's errand.

item.title: the three-day monk

The point is that the entire model deployed by VCs is to profit by disrupting the marketplace with predatory pricing, and leave the losses to the suckers who buy into the IPO.‚ÄùThe dirty little secret that could bring down Big Tech by Adam Rogers | Business Insider

item.title: Eamon
item.description:
@dx
Me: What happens when I want to put the delimiter in my data?
TSV: Simple. Just escape tabs the same way you already escape newlines.
CSV: Ok, so. Sometimes we'll wrap fields in double quotes, and then don't even worry about the commas. Just escape double quotes instead!
Me: So quotes are optional?
CSV: Yes, unless the field contains a comma.
Me: Aren't commas and double quotes more likely to appear in data than tabs?
CSV: Did I mention that many Europeans use semicolons instead of commas?
